title: Festival of Closure
outcome: In the wake of referendum exhaustion, Daria convinces the Council to suspend all authority for a two-week citywide 'Festival of Closure.' Districts enact public rituals and open forums to grieve and celebrate the past. Hidden messages from Halden surface, guiding citizens toward empathy and negotiation. Powerful demonstration sparks unlikely alliances and finally allows the city to mourn—breaking the control of both BCI and the Council for good.

events.description: Council, pressured by Daria and community leaders, announces a two-week suspension of all official governance for a 'Festival of Closure.'
Districts organize shared meals, storytelling, and art events, openly processing the traumas of BCI rule for the first time. Council and BCI systems remain offline.
Spontaneous open forums allow both vanished and loyalist citizens to testify about their experiences—sparking new empathy, sometimes bitter confrontations, but also surprising dialogue.
Encrypted messages, attributed to Halden, are projected onto city walls at night: 'Become your own system. Trust each other.' Ceremony participants debate their meaning, some finding reconciliation.

With the festival's end, citizens organize a permanent assembly based on local delegates—not BCI scoring or Council assignment. The BCI and old Council dissolve quietly, ending the city's algorithmic era.
